question.questionA: Leaves flattened, thin-bladed or only slightly fleshy.
question.questionB: Leaves thick, fleshy or minute on fleshy stems.

question.questionA: Leaves ciliate, lanceolate eglandular.
question.questionB: Leaves usually glabrous, if pubescent then lobed and glandular.

question.questionA: Flowers mostly hermaphrodite; fruit surrounded by two to five persistent perianth segments.
question.questionB: Flowers  all  unisexual;  fruit enclosed in two conspicuous enlarged flattened bracteoles.

question.questionA: Leaves not more than 5 cm, some lobed or dentate.
question.questionB: Some leaves more than 5 cm, all entire.

question.questionA: Perennial herbs; leaves hastate.
question.questionB: Annual herbs; leaves not hastate.

question.questionA: Leaves pubescent glandular, aromatic.
question.questionB: Leaves neither pubescent nor glandular.

question.questionA: Plant smelling of bad fish; leaves rhomboid 5-25 mm, without teeth, grey-green above, mealy grey beneath.
question.questionB: Plant not foul smelling; leaves variously shaped, often dentate.

question.questionA: Leaves coarsely dentate, shining, dark green often turning yellow or red; seeds black with acute margin.
question.questionB: Leaves usually pale or greyish green, not shining.

question.questionA: Leaves at least as broad as long.
question.questionB: Leaves longer than broad.

question.questionA: Leaves thin and translucent, with acute forward-pointing teeth; testa with deep radial furrows.
question.questionB: Leaves not translucent; testa without deep radial furrows.

question.questionA: Leaves green above, mealy glaucous below, margins sinuate dentate; testa without radial furrows.
question.questionB: Leaves mealy on both surfaces, margins not sinuate with or without teeth; testa with shallow radial furrows.

question.questionA: Bracts  absent or very  small  towards  the  apex of  the  inflorescence; segments of fruiting perianth up to 3 mm long, incurved.
question.questionB: Bracts conspicuous throughout the inflorescence; segments of fruiting perianth up to 5 mm long, erect, often incurved at apex.

question.questionA: Small shrubs.
question.questionB: Annual herbs.

question.questionA: Bracteoles of fruit rounded, reniform.
question.questionB: Bracteoles of fruit three-lobed.

question.questionA: Shrubs; leaves ovate, leathery.
question.questionB: Annual herbs; leaves neither ovate nor leathery.

question.questionA: Plant procumbent; leaves lobed; flowers in axillary cymes.
question.questionB: Plant erect; leaves not lobed; flowers in axillary racemes.

question.questionA: Upper  leaves  lanceolate,  lower  diamond-shaped;  bracts  diamond-shaped; flowers pale green.
question.questionB: Leaves hastate; bracts lanceolate; flowers usually red.

question.questionA: Stems not jointed; leaves alternate, spreading.
question.questionB: Stems jointed; leaves minute.

question.questionA: Perianth fleshy in fruit.
question.questionB: Perianth tough with a transverse winged ridge.

question.questionA: Annual herbs.
question.questionB: Rhizomatous shrubs.

question.questionA: Pubescent shrubs.
question.questionB: Annual herbs.

question.questionA: Leaves and bracteoles with short mucronate tips, non-spiny
question.questionB: Leaves and bracteoles spine-tipped.

question.questionA: Annual herbs.
question.questionB: Shrubby plants.

question.questionA: Erect shrub, glaucous becoming yellowish green or reddish; segments generally broader than long; flowers of each segment protruding, free, falling  to  leave  undivided  hollow; seeds black, covered in small tubercles.
question.questionB: Rhizomatous  perennial   with erect green stems; segments generally longer than broad; flowers in cymes, falling to leave tripartite segments; seeds brown covered in hairs.

question.questionA: Rhizomatous mat-forming shrubs, green becoming red or brownish; seeds covered with curved or hooked hairs.
question.questionB: Shrubs not forming mats, glaucous; seeds covered with conical hairs.
